description.plain:
slowthai (the name being a combination of his name and his speech impediment from young which led to a mumbling nature, mentioned in his Radar Radio interview) or more formally known as Tyron Kaymone Frampton (born 18 December 1994) is an English MC with an aggressive, gritty and nihilistic take on the current UK rap scene.

He grew up on a council estate in Northampton by a single mother and since school pursued music.
The Northampton artist released his debut EP I Wish I Knew to much acclaim with music outlets such as Pitchfork and Complex naming him as one to watch in 2018.

In his music, he has a recurring theme of politically charged lyrics in which he titled a tour “Brexit Bandit” and has mentioned Theresa May multiple times, mainly due to his hard upbringing on a council estate and being anti-establishment. He has stated, “My goal is to change the world in some way shape or form”
Read more at at NME.

In 2019, he released his first full-feature album Nothing Great About Britain with high brow features such as fellow British artists Skepta, ​Mura Masa, and Jaykae. This was his most successful release to date with the Guardian music reviewer Alexis Petridis giving it a score of 5 stars out of 5.

He released his sophomore album TYRON in 2021. This time around, the album boasted features from the likes of Denzel Curry, A$AP Rocky, and another from Skepta.

songs.title: T N Biscuits

description.plain:
T N Biscuits is a single released by Northampton artist slowthai in 2017.

Pitchfork explains

On T N Biscuits, Slowthai channels snarling, small-town angst to vicious effect … The track’s title might conjure up images of tea time in quaint villages, but from start to finish, Slowthai raises his tattooed middle finger to any old-fashioned ideas you might have of the UK’s countryside.

songs.title: Inglorious

description.plain:
“Inglorious” marks the first collaboration between slowthai and fellow UK artist Skepta, the two artists each handling one verse on the track.

The song was released as a single just one day prior to the release of Nothing Great About Britain, alongside an accompanying music video starring the two rappers.

The track sees slowthai and Skepta aggressively rapping about their superiority on their “inglorious” opposition, over a Kwes Darko dark and heavy bass production.

songs.title: Nothing Great About Britain

description.plain:
“Nothing Great About Britain” is the intro to slowthai’s debut LP, Nothing Great About Britain.

The song is slowthai’s take on the current depressed British environment, with plenty of notable British cultural references.

The song was originally previewed as an acapella verse for Crack Magazine.

Despite having a negative message on Britain whilst also calling the Queen a cunt, slowthai also expressed his pride of being British but states that “we’re losing sight of what makes us great” in his interview with The Guardian.

songs.title: Gorgeous

description.plain: “Gorgeous” tells the story of slowthai’s childhood, in Northampton. It also mentions the first time he was arrested, and how it was made into a memory as he was with his friends, which made it easier for him. He also reminisces about his school life and how that affected the rest of his life.

songs.title: Ladies

description.plain:
On “Ladies,” slowthai shows his appreciation for women as his mother has been a big part of his life. His dad left when he was only three years old so his mum took care of him and his four siblings by herself. As a result, slowthai grew huge respect for women and single mums with children which this song this is dedicated to.

In a video with Rinse FM, slowthai explained the inspiration behind the song:

So I was just trying to highlight a point
like everyone- you should respect the people who gave birth to you regardless, like cause' you wouldn’t be breathe the air your breathing

songs.title: North Nights

description.plain:
Released as a single on 7 March , 2019, “North Nights” was later added on slowthai’s debut album, Nothing Great About Britain. Despite his growing popularity on the UK rap scene, slowthai’s world view is still focused on what’s happening around him: politics, his ends, rivalry and self-mythologizing. The crackling, minor-key piano loop and a rubbery guitar line, accompanied by a boom-bap beat plays a homage to 90’s hip-hop.

An official music video for “North Nights” was released on 14 March, 2019 on slowthai’s YouTube channel.

songs.title: ENEMY

description.plain:
“ENEMY” is slowthai’s first solo release of 2020, after he provided featured vocals on tracks from Gorillaz and Headie One & Fred again... On the song, slowthai addresses his status as an “enemy” within culture, rapping aggressively about gruesome topics such as shootings, and announcing via a robotic voice that he has been “cancelled.”

With these nods to the negative perception of him, the song responds to the public backlash that thai saw due to his outburst at the 2020 NME Awards. The fact that “NME” and “ENEMY” are pronounced the same way links the two events more obviously. Ironically, the award slowthai was on stage to collect was the “Hero of the Year” award. In this song, therefore, he rebrands himself; he is not a hero, but an enemy.

The track was first teased by thai on May 9, 2020 on his social media. The track was released the next day with an accompanying music video. Stylistically, the video is similar to the video for his March 2017 track “T N Biscuits,” which also features close-up shots of thai filmed through a green night vision lens.

songs.title: Toaster

description.plain:
“Toaster” is the eighth track featured on slowthai’s autobiographical debut album, Nothing Great About Britain. The theme of the song is heavily focused on the struggles thai faced growing up in tough areas of Northampton, thai’s home town. He would constantly get in trouble with the law and the police which he alludes to throughout the track.

Kwes Darko contributed for the production of this track like on the majority of the tracks for Nothing Great About Britain.

An official music video for “Toaster” was released on 25 July, 2019 where slowthai visits his childhood house in Lings, Northampton.

songs.title: Crack

description.plain:
On “Crack,” slowthai compares his love for his significant other to the way an addicted loves drugs. Although the theme of the track is mainly focused on love, thai is undecided between drugs and his lover. As a result, this leads to a break-up and becoming increasingly toxic against each other.

London based music collective, Earbuds joins in on the track to produce a low-fi type beat for slowthai’s calm vocals.
